sentences.english: Who will tell the children those 3)outlandish stories?
sentences.chinese: 谁将把这些稀奇古怪的故事告诉我们的后辈呢？

sentences.english: The use of animals in eccentric acts appears to have increased.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇古怪的动物选手似乎越来越多。

sentences.english: Curiously, this is across both 3G and Wifi networks.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇古怪地，在3G和Wifi网络都是这样。

sentences.english: He collected a quantity of curious information.
sentences.chinese: 他搜集了大量稀奇古怪的消息。

sentences.english: Cracked and husky voices pronounced forcibly upon odd matters.
sentences.chinese: 粗哑的声音在使劲地讲述着稀奇古怪的事情。

sentences.english: Gone are the big round eyes and the strange hair colours.
sentences.chinese: 大大的圆眼睛和稀奇古怪的发色已经不流行了。

sentences.english: This is an odd collection of people.
sentences.chinese: 这是一群稀奇古怪的人。

sentences.english: During the fever he became delirious and said some strange things.
sentences.chinese: 发高烧时他神志昏迷，说了些稀奇古怪的事。

sentences.english: These rare and Pindaric combinations merely prove the poet's enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 恰恰是这种稀奇古怪的杂交，证明了作者的激情。

sentences.english: He would invent fanciful names on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 他会当场编造出一些稀奇古怪的货名。

sentences.english: We love him because he is full of fanciful stories.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢他是因为他有一肚子稀奇古怪的故事。

sentences.english: He quavered forth a quaint old ditty .
sentences.chinese: 他用颤抖的嗓音哼了一首稀奇古怪的古老小调。
莎拉有一些稀奇古怪的想法。

definition: fantastic oddities of every description (idiom); grotesquely shaped
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
an assortment/a bit of everything/lots of different (skills)
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
all kinds of/all sorts of/every (different) kind of
